nodes.bodyText:
checkstyle/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/FullIdent.java
    
    
         Line 44
      in
      ae9edbd
    
    
    
    

        
          
           private DetailAST detailAst; 
        
    
  


FullIdent holds the AST too.
Is there any difference between the new AST passed in and the one in FullIdent? If so, what is the difference? If not, doesn't it make sense to use that instead?
@rnveach can you please elaborate me more on this change,

You changed the code to pass in the AST, but the AST is available from the FullIdent.
I am asking, are the 2 ASTs the same instance? If they are not, explain what each one points to.

example:
import java.util.List;
ast:import>java>util>List(traversal)
detailAst:java

To confirm, detailAst is from FullIdent and ast is AST being passed in method parameter?
If so, will detailAst.getParent() always point to ast then?

Yes, detailAst is from FullIdent and ast is the AST passed in method parameter of visitiToken();
No, detailAst.getParent() isn't pointing to ast.(They are pointing to different nodes)

IMPORT -> import [1:0]
|--DOT -> . [1:16]
|  |--DOT -> . [1:11]
|  |  |--IDENT -> java [1:7]
|  |  `--IDENT -> util [1:12]
|  `--IDENT -> List [1:17]
`--SEMI -> ; [1:21]

You are correct. I thought the tree looked different.
Ok, I am good to leave it as using the custom AST in the memory parameter. It makes more sense to have the violation be the import itself.
If this stays, this isn't "the line" anymore.
